What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER option in Verus is set to 1024. When this option is not set on a gateway, top-level ID and currency registration occur on the launch chain. This means that if the gateway does not have a specific name controller option set, the registration of IDs and currencies happens on the chain where the gateway is launched.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
What is the purpose of the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN option in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN option in Verus is set to 2048. This option enables the creation of a single satoshi NFT (non-fungible token) that tokenizes control over the root ID. This means that the NFT token represents ownership and control over the root ID, and can be used to manage and transfer that control.

ill publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
